Case reference: 2014004240.CaseDesc: Sheilagh Coleman was reported missing on August 22, 2000 by her mother. Her mother last saw her on August 1, 2000 when she visited her in Gibsons, B.C. The last reliable sighting of Sheilagh was believed to be August 21, 2000 by a neighbour. They saw her leaving the residence of her boyfriend on her bicycle. Numerous people were interviewed that were associated to her and was much contradiction regarding the dates and events in order of which Sheilagh was last seen.

Case reference: 2012020100.CaseDesc: On June 29, 2006, the remains of a Caucasian woman were discovered in an old well in Saskatoon, SK.  Her remains appear to have been there for many decades.  There are injuries on the remains that suggest she may have been a victim of foul play.

Skirt: Cotton, Black, White, poplin skirt, ruffled edge with silk bodice
Underwear: Cotton, White, pre-1920 corset with stays
Boots: Leather, Black, ladies-front lace up pointed toe, circa 1910

Case reference: 2021054828.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2021, at approximately 6:30 p.m., Berhanei Peynado was seen for the last time in the area of Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Berhanei was despondent.

Shoes: Black, White, RUNNING, Brand: Air Jordan
Coat: Black, WINTER, Winter coat with fur collar
Hat: Black, Gold, BASEBALL, Baseball hat with gold maple leaf
Tattoo: Chest, Wolf, arc angel with sword

Case reference: 2014005000.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2004, Mr. Lathlin was reported missing to police by his wife. She indicated to police the last time she saw Mr. Lathlin was on June 14th at which time he was leaving for Winnipeg from The Pas for a medical appointment on the 15th. He did not take any clothing and only took personal grooming items. Mr. Lathlin later called advising his wife he would be staying in Winnipeg as he had another appointment on Thursday. He again called his wife on Saturday morning asking for money. His wife sent the money as requested, however by Tuesday it was not claimed and it was returned to her. Mr. Lathlin has a history of living on the streets and has ties to Edmonton where he spent years on the street there. He also has various medical concerns. It is believed that Mr. Lathlin is likely in Winnipeg of his own volition. Mr. Lathlin's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014005585.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Amanda McLeod was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001603.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1992, Richard Liboiron was seen for the last time as he left a hotel in Gatineau, Quebec. Mr. Liboiron and a friend departed from the hotel on a snowmobile heading in the direction towards Ottawa. The two crossed the Ottawa River and did not make it to the shore.

Case reference: 2015011650.CaseDesc: On June 15, 2000, the Coast Guard noticed the body of a male floating in the waters of the Saint Lawrence River near the Port of Montreal wharf.

Teeth: Other, Sup. maxillary- dental prosthesis. Inf. maxillary- no teeth
Jewelry: Brown, Wooden cross pendant with leather cord.
Socks: Green, Grey, Green top with grey foot
Boots: Brown, Isolated 120, plus protector, with laces
Sweater: Cotton, Black, T-shirt, written "BEAT MOLSON DRY" "BEAT STAFF MOLSON DRY"
Coat: Nylon, Black, Synthetic lining, imitation sheep. Hooded, size medium

Case reference: 2006024499.CaseDesc: Allan MacKenzie was last seen in Chapleau, Ontario on November 5, 1987. He was making a delivery with his red and green tractor/trailer to the Ministry of Natural Resources in Chapleau and then believed to be enroute to Toronto, Ontario. He was subsequently reported overdue in Toronto and has not been seen since. His trailer and tractor were located, parked north of Sultan, ON.

Case reference: 2014002220.CaseDesc: Melvin Hoel was last seen in the Cataract Creek area where his abandoned vehicle with all his belongings was located by agents of Fish and Wildlife.

Case reference: 2020028325.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2020, the body of a man was found on the banks of the Saint-Lawrence River in the area of Notre-Dame-des-Sept-Douleurs, Quebec.

Underwear: Cotton, Black, Fruit of the Loom brand, Boxer style
Sweater: Cotton, Black, T-Shirt, Kirkland brand, size M

Case reference: 2016061146.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1964, the body of what was described as a young male was recovered from Lake Erie, off the tip of Long Point, adjacent to the Township of South Walsingham, County Norfolk. His post-mortem weight was recorded at approximately 190 lbs. Due to decompositional changes and post-mortem injury, this may not be an accurate reflection of his living weight. His appendix was present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a minimum of 3 months.

Teeth: Amalgam fillings in some of his molars and a gold inlay in his lower right 2nd molar.
Bathing Suit: Brown, Tan, trunks with a black/dark blue stripe on each side (34" waist)

Case reference: 2009003899.CaseDesc: Investigation revealed that Emile Ruger, who resides on Brookdale Ave., had not paid his rent for the month of March and April 2008.  Mr. Ruger usually pays his rent three days in advance to the month due. He was last seen mid-February 2008 and his whereabouts are unknown. Last Seen: Rooming House on Brookdale Avenue

Case reference: 2006021799.CaseDesc: Leo Payash, aged 8, was last seen on July 01, 1957. He and his mother Cecilia Payash, aged 48 years, were walking on Red Lake Road and neither has been seen since.

Deformity: Nose, Described as having a "hooked" nose

Case reference: 2019002992.CaseDesc: On August 25, 2018, Anupama Nadagouda was seen for the last time with her daughter, Anvita Mulemane, in India.

Case reference: 2008245047.CaseDesc: Jadon may be in the company of his non-custodial mother Roxana Eliana YANEZ PARADA.

Case reference: 2014005030.CaseDesc: Wilfrid Langlois has been missing since February 5, 1998. At the time of his disappearance, it is possible that he was in the Chandler area of the Gaspé Peninsula.

Case reference: 2008009598.CaseDesc: Mario Palermo was reported missing on January 20, 1978, by his mother. At that time, Mr. Palermo was living at home and was single. The last contact family members had with him was on January 8, 1978 when his mother received a Grey Coach parcel sent from Orillia which contained a pair of boots that he had borrowed from his brother and two boxes of chocolates.

Case reference: 2017001353.CaseDesc: On December 30, 2016 at 2:00 a.m., Derek Ritz was last seen on foot in Sebringville, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001408.CaseDesc: On September 13th, 1997, two fishermen failed to show up at their final destination and as a result they were reported missing to police. An immediate search of the lake was conducted and one of the men was found alive on a island. HUNTER was never found.

Case reference: 2016068950.CaseDesc: On March 2, 1978, a Caucasian male jumped off the Municipal Parking Garage, 65 Pitt Street East, Windsor. Prior to jumping he had told an observer that his name was Lester, that he was depressed and had been in the hospital.

Case reference: 2006017399.CaseDesc: Mary Frances Gregory left her home in Parry Sound, Ontario on February 15, 1978, to vacation in California. She failed to arrive at her destination in Palo Alto, California and has not contacted any family members or friends since. Ms. Gregory is believed to have departed Canada by motor vehicle with a male acquaintance who states that he let her off at a bus station in Las Vegas, Nevada some ten days after leaving Canada. The driver claims to have driven to Nevada via the States of New York, Pennsylvania, Ohio, Illinois, Colorado, Utah, and Arizona.

Mark: Right Abdomen, Brown, in shape of 5 cent piece (10mm)

Case reference: 2010001999.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Dekleyn was last seen on December 3, 1992, at 1:35 p.m. on a Hamilton RBC bank surveillance camera, making a withdrawal from an ATM machine. Family have not seen or heard from him since and described Mr. Dekleyn as being depressed.

Jacket: Brown, with the Dempsters logo on the left chest
Scar: Torso (Front), Front-to-Back scar on abdomen from surgery to remove kidney.

Case reference: 2020017934.CaseDesc: On May 15, 2020, Lebohang Nicol was seen for the last time in the area of 600 University Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Lebohang is also known to go by the first name of “Toby.” He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2009004899.CaseDesc: Sacha Latulippe left Montreal Airport for Mexico city on October 15, 2009. He advised his family he was leaving for business. Investigation revealed he had 2 wives in different towns and was leading a “double life”. He left with his business partner Eric Marcel on this same flight. Mr. Marcel is also missing.

Hair: Blonde, Brush Cut, Spikey/gelled, natural brown; Sideburns

Case reference: 2014004934.CaseDesc: On February 28, 1976, at approximately 5:30 pm, Jean Cardinale was seen for the last at the Bayview Village Plaza in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014027689.CaseDesc: Sindy Ruperthouse's family has had no news of her since April 2014 and on September 2, 2014, they reported her missing to the Sûreté du Québec of Amos. Mrs. Ruperthouse was last seen in Val d'Or on April 22, 2014 during a consultation at the Local Community Service Centre (CLSC).

Case reference: 2017076317.CaseDesc: Dakota Anzovino was last seen on December 23, 2017, in the City of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Boots: Tan, Black, Winter, Brand: "Sorel"; with white fur
Jeans: Denim, Grey, Light Blue, Or grey in colour
Jacket: Black, Grey, Plaid with dark hood

Case reference: 2014002353.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1978, two men found a racing canoe and reported the incident to police. During the resulting investigation it was discovered there were two men in the canoe who apparently were going out to dig for Seneca root. According to witnesses who observed the men leave; indicated they left in adverse weather conditions which included high winds. Mr. Buck has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2006008299.CaseDesc: Richard Rollo jumped out of his boat into Muskrat Lake, near Gull Rock, Cobden, Ontario in 1997 and never resurfaced.  He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014001545.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 6th of August 1979, Timothy Papik and his daughter Diane left Rankin Inlet, NU. heading towards Whale Cove, NU. in a canoe. They never reached their destination and they have not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Knife with snake, flower

Case reference: 2019024246.CaseDesc: On May 6, 2019, Daniel Richards was seen for the last time in the area of Niagara Falls, Ontario. Niagara Police responded to a report of a man that had jumped into the falls. The police were able to obtain a description and a photograph of the man who was identified as Daniel. His vehicle was located abandoned in the nearby area.

Case reference: 2013000051.CaseDesc: Darren Fortier was last seen hitchhiking in Port Hardy on the evening of December 30, 1998.  Mr. Fortier had been involved in a serious injury a few years earlier which had left him with a metal plate and pins in his leg and a brain injury.

Hat: Cotton, Blue, Maroon, Colorado Avalanche Baseball Cap
Scar: Chin, Distinct on the left side of chin
Cheek, Down the right side of the face
Nose, Across the bridge of the nose
Foreign Object: Left Thigh, Surgical Implant, Plate and 5 screws

Case reference: 2016061103.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2003, a male was found in the Detroit River, near the Livingston Channel in Amherstburg. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He may have been a heavy coffee drinker or smoker. His appendix was present. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Hair: Black, Brown, Straight, Greying moustache and beard
Teeth: Upper denture and a lower partial plate
Other: Detroit area bus pass dated November 2002
Jacket: Dark Green, Orange, Bomber style, knitted waist and cuffs, orange lining

Case reference: 2014002336.CaseDesc: On March 22, 1993, Yolande Bouchard was going to meet her sister at the mall in Trois-Rivières at 4:00 p.m. She never arrived and was reported missing at that time. Her car was later found in Trois-Rivières Ouest with two offence tickets on the windshield.

Case reference: 2014005970.CaseDesc: Gary Forster was last seen on January 13, 2013, in Lachute, Québec. His car was found in Montréal, Québec.

Case reference: 2008003199.CaseDesc: Police received information that Toivo Reinikainen had not returned to work at the Great West Timber Camp on the Deadhorse Road in Walsh Twp (northern Ontario).  He had been observed on site on September 26, 1984 at 4:00 a.m. by his co-workers.  The camp location is a relatively remote area, access is by Deadhorse Road which is open to the public.

Case reference: 2012020117.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1995, Chantal Picotte was reported missing by her mother. Chantal was last seen on the evening of Wednesday, November 22, 1995 at a bar in Saint-Jérôme, Quebec.  She had called her mother that evening asking her to come see her. The next day, Chantal's mother went to her daughter’s residence, but Chantal was not there. The mother made several attempts to call her daughter without any success.

Case reference: 2014003023.CaseDesc: Joseph Roussel was last seen climbing Mount Edith Cavell in Jasper National Park.

Case reference: 2012020075.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1974, Annie Yassie was seen for the last time by a taxi driver in Churchill, Manitoba. At that time, Annie was accompanied by a male friend.

Case reference: 2014004814.CaseDesc: Stephanie Stewart was employed as a Fire Spotter at the Athabasca Lookout near Hinton, Alberta when she disappeared on August 26, 2006. She was 70 years old at the time of her disappearance. Stephanie led an active lifestyle and was in good health. Her disappearance is being treated as suspicious. The police investigation is ongoing.

Case reference: 2020009578.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1989, at approximately 1:00am, Andrew Gunzinger was seen for the last time leaving his girlfriend’s father’s farm near Orangeville, Ontario. Prior to leaving, Andrew and his girlfriend had gotten into a dispute.

Case reference: 2014001355.CaseDesc: Mr. Aurèle Massey was last seen on August 8, 1983 in Montreal. He left his residence to have his vehicle repaired, but never returned. Mr. Massey was despondent and had mentioned that he wanted to jump into the Soulanges Canal.

Case reference: 2012020138.CaseDesc: The 18 month old Yohanna went missing after the mother entrusted the custody of her daughter to her boyfriend while she was out of town for a few days. They all lived in the Saint Laurent area in Montreal. Upon her return to Montreal, the mother was told that her baby was in Washington with the boyfriend’s mother. She went to the United States to find her daughter, but could not locate her. Returning to Quebec, the mother alerted the police of her child’s disappearance. The boyfriend claimed then that the child drowned in the bathtub during the mother’s absence and that she had been buried before the mother’s return. He was questioned and then released due to lack of evidence.

Case reference: 2013000071.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1993, Jean-Jacques Cantin was seen for the last time in the Ahuntsic district of Montreal, Quebec. His mother went to his apartment where she found packages that were prepared for different people. His personal belongings and clothes had disappeared.

Case reference: 2018063467.CaseDesc: On December 12, 1995, at approximately 2:00 am, Ahmad Kharashfeh was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Jacket: Leather, Black, Short jacket with 2 red lines in the front

Case reference: 2014005569.CaseDesc: Steven O’Brien was last seen on March 20, 1993. He was a first-year student at Holland College’s Culinary Institute in Charlottetown when he went missing after a night out with friends. Steven was last seen walking south on Queen Street in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, around 1:30 am.

Case reference: 2005001199.CaseDesc: On May 3, 1975, the remains of a female were found in the Nation River near a bridge crossing Highway 417 in Casselman, Ontario. She has dyed reddish blonde hair that was naturally dark brown. Her finger and toe nails had red nail polish on them. She may have been a smoker. The cause of death was strangulation. A piece of television coaxial cable was found around her neck. A curtain rod runner (plastic wheel) was found in her left armpit. Her hands and feet were tied with men's neckties, one of which is called "The Canadian Tie". Her remains may have been in the water for some days to some months.

Teeth: Other, She has extensive dental work including both an upper and lower partial denture, as well as many fillings.
Other: Towel, red and white “J cloth" brand.
2 Throw cover, green with frills on ends, 70”x40”
Towels, White & red tea towel by FREIMAN'S LTD "Irish Toast"
Tie: Blue, Red, Maple leaf emblems, Bartolini Collection

Case reference: 2006011499.CaseDesc: Gordon Berg was a passenger in a boat, fishing on Sturgeon Lake about 125 km west of Armstrong, Ontario, on October 10, 1969. The boat capsized in rough water, and the occupants were thrown into the lake. He was last seen as he drifted away from the boat. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Other, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2019052051.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2019, at approximately 4:00 am, Brandon Pollock was seen for the last time at his family residence in Hamilton, Ontario. That same morning, three men on a boat observed a man swimming in the area of the Lift Bridge in Lake Ontario. The men approached the swimmer, who was later identified as Brandon Pollock, to confirm his wellbeing. Brandon had told them that he was okay and advised them to pass by.

Mark: Right Side Of Neck, A brown birthmark on the right side of the neck, below the ear

Case reference: 2014005339.CaseDesc: Gilles Lacroix, a priest, was last seen on August 31, 2009 in Boucherville. He was living in Longueuil. He left in his vehicle. His vehicle was found September 5, 2009.

Case reference: 2006016699.CaseDesc: Michael Gadke and Morris Werenko were last seen in around Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, and were last heard from as they were circling over Goulais Bay in a Cessna C-172 aircraft. The Cessna C-172, had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red.

Case reference: 2014003882.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1991, Marcel Paquette was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec when he left in his car to visit his family in the Gaspésie region. His vehicle was located near the city of Causapscal, Quebec. Marcel is diabetic and may have memory problems.

Tattoo: Right Chest, Devil and "Renee et Marie" in text
Left Chest, Heart and "Diane" in text

Case reference: 2017021635.CaseDesc: On April 24th, 2017, Kevin Sadownyk was last seen in Okotoks, Alberta. Kevin’s truck was found abandoned just outside of Banff, Alberta the next day.

Case reference: 2014006541.CaseDesc: Roxanne Fleming has not been seen since approximately 1986.  Around the time of last contact, she spent time in Lillooet, BC, Kamloops, BC, Vancouver, BC, Red Deer, AB, and Edmonton, AB.  The circumstances of her disappearance are unknown.

Case reference: 2014001165.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2005, the body of an adult male was recovered from the lower Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 174 lbs and his length was measured at 5'6", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His teeth are stained suggesting that he may have been a smoker. He is circumcised and his appendix is present. He was not wearing any clothing or jewelry. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days prior to his recovery.

Hair: Black, Grey, Short, Straight, Trimmed moustache with a goatee
Teeth: Crowded, Upper & lower teeth crowded in front. Dental work including a gold crown on left upper 1st molar & two root canal treatments.
Scar: Left Hand, 3cm and 2 cm scars, inner wrist

Case reference: 2014004467.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1997, Sadhi, Samia, Samir, and Saeed Jiredeh were last seen as they left their home with their father in Toronto, Ontario. That day, their parents had gotten into an argument prior to them leaving.

Case reference: 2014002370.CaseDesc: On June 16, 1997, at approximately 4:30 pm Kelvin Zdarski and two friends left Dauphin, Manitoba and headed for a cabin near Waterhen, Manitoba. Over the course of the evening there was an argument between the men. Kelvin left the cabin and never returned. The men looked for him on their way back to Dauphin and did not see him. A man matching Kelvin's description was seen walking on the road at 7:30 am on the 17th of June. An extensive search by land, air and water proved negative. Kelvin did not take his wallet, money or any identification to the cabin and had no means of transportation. Mr. Zdarski has not been seen or heard from again.

Scar: Left Calf, 1 inch long, back of calf

Case reference: 2013000013.CaseDesc: On April 27, 1967, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Marianne Schuett was seen for the last time in the vicinity of the Kilbride Public School's driveway in North Burlington, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Marianne was seen talking to an unknown man in a vehicle, and it is believed that she was abducted by this man.

Hair: Brown, Bangs in front, ear length at back

Case reference: 2016065867.CaseDesc:
On May 1, 1976 the skeletal remains of a male, were located in area of heavy bush north of Hwy 17 (0.5 miles east of Hodder Avenue on the Lakehead Expressway near a scenic lookout), Thunder Bay.
Police reports approximate the height of the deceased to be 5'8", however, no anthropological analysis was carried out on the long bones so this value is merely a non-scientific estimate. It is believed that he died approximately 10 months to 5 years prior to discovery.

Hair: Brown, Long, Tied back with elastic fasteners with plastic balls
Teeth: Complete acrylic upper denture. Several molars & premolars extracted from lower jaw. Many remaining teeth show signs of decay
Other: Paper matches with the zodiac theme "the moon" on them
Shirt: Grey or off-white sweatshirt with a crew neck collar
Belt: Leather, Brown, 37" from the hole used to the tongue of the buckle

Case reference: 2014004993.CaseDesc: On the 5th of July, 2002, Percy McKenzie was last seen near Powell Island on Lac La Ronge lake, La Ronge, Saskatchewan. Mr. McKenzie was alone and the lake was very rough at the time. Searches failed to locate Percy McKenzie.

Case reference: 2014004460.CaseDesc: Tsuguo Moroto left his place of business in Banff and rented a car on July 21, 1985. Several days later the vehicle was located at Panther Falls on Highway 93 North near Lake Louise, Alberta.  Several ground, aerial and waterway searches were conducted without success. Mr. Moroto was never located.

Case reference: 2012020028.CaseDesc: Chantelle Bushie was reported missing by her family on September 14, 2009. She has not been heard from since December 2007. Chantelle was known to lead a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014002482.CaseDesc: On January 29, 1994, Hubertus Fischer was seen for the last time as he was travelling, by car, to Seattle, Washington. On February 16, the vehicle was found abandoned on a forest service road near Seattle. During the time of his disappearance, Hubertus was residing in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2006006699.CaseDesc: Eric Larsfolk and John McCormick were last seen playing at the McCormick farm in Caledon. They have not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003349.CaseDesc: On March 14, 1993, Carl Berg Ellingsen was seen for the last time with his family at his residence in the East Vancouver region of British Columbia. Carl has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020014.CaseDesc: Sharon Gayle Dawson was seen for the last time on Christmas day in 2010, when she left her home in Qualicum Beach on Vancouver Island, British Columbia. There is an unconfirmed report that she was seen on December 28, 2010 at the World Parrot Refuge near Coombs, B.C.

Case reference: 2006000399.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1988, the body of a Caucasian male was recovered from the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 132lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Auburn, Bald, Wavy, Balding in front, sideburns and unshaven with several days growth
Teeth: Many amalgam fillings, 1 composite resin restoration. Missing multiple upper and lower posterior teeth prior to death.
Jeans: Blue, "Renée de France" Brand, size 34" waist and 34" inseam
Money: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Canadian coins $2.26, one American dime
Belt: Leather, Brown, Size 34, with gold buckle & "Genuine Olde English Leather" written on the inner portion
Fractured/Broken Bones: Healed fracture, noticeable bump on the middle of his right collarbone.

Case reference: 2019073876.CaseDesc: On November 1, 2019, Anton Katona was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017014429.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1982 the body of a man was recovered from the Bow River in Calgary, Alberta. The individual had multiple fingers amputated and had an unhealed break in his right arm.

Shirt: Yellow, Black, TSHIRT, Number 38 on front in black letters
Jacket: Beige, Blue, ZIPUP, Blue plaid inside
Denim, Blue, Sheepskin lining, snaps on front
Scar: Left Little Finger, On distal end of palmar side
Right Side Of Head, 3 cm long on right front parietal region
Tattoo: Left Hand, "F" between forefinger and thumb
Mark: Left Thigh, Biopsy site mid left femur
Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Forearm, Healing fracture of distal ulna
Amputation: Left Hand, Amputation through base of thumb
Left Hand, Amputation through PIP joint on the 2nd through 5th fingers
Right Hand, Amputation through PIP joint on the 2nd through 5th fingers

Case reference: 2014006556.CaseDesc: On the 23rd of July, 2006, Preston WALDNER was swimming at Paradise Beach, South Saskatchewan River, when he and another fellow were attempting to swim across the river. The boys got part way across when they ran into trouble due to the very strong current of the river. The one fellow was pulled from the river and survived, however Mr. WALDNER was seen going under and he never resurfaced. A search was conducted but Mr. WALDNER has not been located.

Tattoo: Left Chest, Howling wolf with the initial "PWW" above the wolf

Case reference: 2014004748.CaseDesc: On February 26, 2006, Diana “Daya” Gregory was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. On that day, Diana had planned to visit her sister, but did not show up. She is known to use the Edmonton Transit Service (ETS) when she travelled within the city, and resided in the downtown core.

Case reference: 2019071976.CaseDesc: In September of 2012, Donald Watson was last seen by his mother, and his family has had no contact with him since this time. Donald is transient in nature and usually travels on foot as transportation. Canada Border Services Agency’s last documentation of Donald was in 2013 when he entered Laredo, Texas in the United States from Mexico as a pedestrian.

Case reference: 2016003652.CaseDesc: Shelley Desrochers was last seen on January 2, 2016 in London (ON). Police and family are concerned for her well being.

Other:
Cell Phone, Lost cell phone 
BLACK ZTE GRAND X2 Z850
S# 867239025096526 & SS 326E52104380
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Rose, Heart & blue bird

Case reference: 2014005279.CaseDesc: Brian Guberman was reported missing in July 1974. Brian owned a black and yellow 1964 Volkswagon van that has never been located.

Case reference: 2012020106.CaseDesc: Danielle Boisvert, 18 years old, disappeared November 6, 1979. On that day, Danielle was last seen leaving a bar in Montreal-North, Québec.

Case reference: 2012020045.CaseDesc: The RCMP is seeking assistance in locating Shirley Ann WAQUAN. She was last seen on July 1, 2007 in Fort McMurray.

Case reference: 2017045625.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1997, the skeletal remains of a man were found in a wooded area in Notre-Dame-de-Porneuf, Quebec.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Chest, 2nd rib on right side healed

Case reference: 2015011629.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2013 a man was found in the waters of the St. Lawrence River on the banks of the Bellerive Park. He had a new cigarette pack, still packed in his right pocket of his coat. The man wore his watch on the left wrist. A backpack was found near the body in which there were clothes and an English book by JJR Tolkien "The Lord of the Rings".

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Milano brand watch
Shirt: Cotton, Dark Blue, Red, checkered; size XXL; written "Street Legal"
Hat: Black, Nascar racing cap written "Dupont Motor Sport" on top
Coat: Black, President Stone with a hoodie; size XL
Boots: Leather, Black, Dakota working boots; size 10; yellow sole

Case reference: 2012020116.CaseDesc: On April 1, 1975, Sylvie Ouimet left the Albert-Prevost institution, where she was hospitalized, without any of her personal effects. Her family has not heard from her since.

Scar: Ears, Surgical scar behind the ear

Case reference: 2005000199.CaseDesc: On October 13, 2005, an unidentified man was discovered in a wooded area in Bruce County in Tobermory, Ontario.

Teeth: Extensive metal and composite resin (white) fillings, but his general dental health was excellent
Jacket: Blue, elastic waist and cuffs; Canada Post logo on left chest
Glasses: Other, Wire frames, prescription, near sightedness
Other: hunting knife with a black plastic handle and the initials "EH" engraved on the end of the handle
Vest: Blue, size 3XL; with a Canada Post logo.

Case reference: 2014001181.CaseDesc: On December 2nd, 2007, Codiac RCMP responded to a complaint of a person found deceased, close to Mapleton Road, in Moncton, NB. A known DNA sample was collected and compared to several persons who believed they could be family relatives. Those comparisons were unsuccessful. To date, all attempts to identify the deceased person have failed.

Case reference: 2008008198.CaseDesc: Gerald Hart was last seen at around midnight on Christmas Eve on Symmes St, travelling on foot towards Main St in the City of Niagara Falls (the casino district).  Mr. Hart was reported to have been in an intoxicated state.

Case reference: 2012020139.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1981, 16 year old Myriam Isabelle Kniaz was seen for the last time at the residence of her foster family located in Ste-Foy, Quebec .

Case reference: 2014002517.CaseDesc: Hélène Laferrière was seen for the last time on October 5, 1976, in the Saint-Sacrement District in Quebec City, Quebec. Hélène has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001967.CaseDesc: Mary Agnes Thomas was last seen on September 10, 1971 in a bush camp on the Fraser River approximately 2.4 kilometers from Quesnel, BC. Mrs. Thomas was with friends and is described as having been heavily intoxicated at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2018070168.CaseDesc: On November 7, 1986, the remains of a man were found near Floating Stone Lake in Alberta. This individual was deaf in their right ear. He had no upper teeth and likely wore an upper denture.

Case reference: 2012020147.CaseDesc: On March 25, 1996, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Upper Levels Highway in West Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had recovered from severe injuries to his right arm and leg. He also had a fractured skull, nose and ribs. These injuries were likely a result of a single major accident. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Corduroy, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 3/4 length coat with fleece
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Side Of Head, Recent fracture to the left temporal bone above the left ear
Nose, Old nasal fracture with visible deformity
Deformity: Shoulders, Old injury; no indication of which shoulder

Case reference: 2014005145.CaseDesc: Sometime after July 30, 1939, Charles "Henry" Baxter went missing from the Hawarden District, SK. At the time of his disappearance, it was thought that Mr. Baxter went across the river to Tichfield to find work, or even joined the military and went overseas. However, Mr. Baxter was never seen again by his family, and these theories have never been substantiated.

Case reference: 2006016399.CaseDesc: Noriharu Amano was last seen on July 24, 2005 at the airport on Airport Road in Sault Ste. Marie. He left in a Cessna C-172 aircraft which had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red. The Cessna was last heard from as it was circling over Goulais Bay.

Case reference: 2014006281.CaseDesc: Originally from the Ivory Coast, Mr. Anvire moved to Ottawa when he was 11 years old and remained in Ottawa until his disappearance in 2009. Mr. Anvire contacted his employer in October 2009 and stated that he was going to Montreal and has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2014002002.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1977, Gaetan Pichette was seen for the last time in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. His family and friends have not seen or heard from him since.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Arm tattoo, inscribed with "COCU"

Case reference: 2013000133.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2013, Prince Edward OPP (Picton) were advised of a 30 ft sailboat that had run aground on the shores at Point Petre (Lake Ontario). It was determined that the sailboat was from Rochester, New York and had left the Chimney Bluff State Park Marina (New York) on July 13,  2013 in the morning. Based on GPS tracks the investigators suspect that Scott French went overboard in American waters, and the boat drifted into Canadian Waters.

Hair: Brown, Brush Cut, Balding at the front
Shoes: Leather, White, New Balance, Running shoe

Case reference: 2014004013.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1997, Eric Pouliot said he was departing to go up north for a maximum of 48 hours, but he never returned. He had little money and no vehicle. At the time of his disappearance, Eric lived in the LeMoyne district of Longueuil, Quebec for one week.

Case reference: 2013000092.CaseDesc: Jacques Boulanger was last seen on September 1, 1989 from Montreal. Jacques loved sleeping outside even though he had a home.

Case reference: 2017072253.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2017, Nadia Atwi was seen for the last time in Edmonton at approximately 6:30 in the morning.  Her abandoned vehicle was located in Rundle Park, Edmonton later the same day.

Case reference: 2013000006.CaseDesc: Joseph Taylor was last seen leaving his residence around midnight on July 30, 2001. He left his residence in a despondent state. It is believed he has started a new life and possibly a new identity for himself in the area around Kelowna in British Columbia. He may be working as a general labourer.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Sword with snake around (5cm)

Case reference: 2014006195.CaseDesc: On April 12, 2004, Randy Boudreau was last seen at his residence in Campbellton, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2013000101.CaseDesc: Oswald Bear left his parents home in Peguis First Nation, Manitoba to go to the bush a short distance east of the house and cut some wood. Mr. Bear was very familiar with the area and enjoyed chopping wood. He spent a lot of time there and knew it well. He had never been lost in the bush and had never failed to return home previously. He visited at his sister's residence nearby at 6:15 p.m. Shortly thereafter, his sister told him that he should go home so that their mother wouldn't worry. When Mr. Bear left his sisters's residence, his intention was to go home, but he has not been seen since.
